newsitem.title: UK: Ofgas to examine British Gas selective price cuts.
newsitem.headline: Ofgas to examine British Gas selective price cuts.

text.p: Britain's gas industry regulator Ofgas said on Thursday it was trying to decide whether British Gas should be prevented from offering selective price cuts to customers in the southwest of England.
In a statement, Ofgas said it would consult on whether price competition has been adequately established in the southwest and it requested responses from interested parties by March 20.

"I want to make it clear that I have not approved British Gas Trading's new ValuePlus direct debit tariff and I am concerned that the selective price cuts British Gas Trading is offering in the south west could stiffle competition," Ofgas director general Claire Spottiswoode said in the statement.
